author: Bhana Neur
content: Cole Brauer, a 29-year-old woman from New York, sailed over 26,000 nautical miles in 130 days. She is the first American woman to sail solo around the world. She took off on the journey in October 2023, off the coast of A Coruna, in Spain. On March 7, she completed her journey in Spain, where she reunited with her family.
title: Meet Cole Brauer, 1st US woman to sail solo non stop around globe

author: Sports Gaga Partner
content: Captain Rohit Sharma, dubbed the "Hitman," stands tall in WTC history with 9 centuries and 7 fifties from a mere 54 innings. His remarkable feat cements his status as one of cricket's finest. With elegant stroke play and unwavering composure, Sharma's legacy as one of the greatest batsmen of his generation is etched indelibly in the annals of the game.
title: Captainâ€™s stunning WTC stat: 9 hundreds & 7 fifties in 54 innings

author: FPJ Online Edit
content: There's considerable speculation surrounding cricketer Mohammed Shami's potential entry into politics following reports that the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has approached him to contest from the Basirhat Lok Sabha constituency. Yet, it remains unclear whether Shami has accepted the BJP's proposal or not. Currently, Shami (33) is recovering from an injury.
title: Shami likely to contest LS polls from Basirhat on BJP ticket

author: Sports Gaga Partner
content: Shubman Gill swiftly reached his fifty in 64 balls on the second morning, maintaining his momentum from the previous evening. Unfazed by England's seamers, he attacked James Anderson early in the day. With a decisive step out, he lofted Anderson for a commanding six, earning nods of approval from England's captain, Ben Stokes.
title: Viral video: Ben Stokes applauds as Gill's bat dominates Anderson

author: Anmol Sharma
content: India captain Rohit Sharma on Friday smashed his 48th international hundred by reaching the three-figure mark off 154 deliveries in India's first innings in the Dharamshala Test against England.  Rohit has equalled Rahul Dravid's tally of 48 international hundreds. Only Virat Kohli (80) and Sachin Tendulkar (100) have hit more hundreds than Dravid and Rohit for India in international cricket.
title: Rohit Sharma smashes his 48th international hundred, equals Rahul Dravid's tally

author: Vaidehi
content: Gujarat Titans have been handed a massive blow with star Australian player missing the opening match. Matthew Wade is set to miss GT's opening game of IPL 2024 in order to prioritise the Sheffield Shield. "He's spoken with his IPL franchise and they're happy to allow him to stay here," the Tasmania Head Coach told reporters.
title: Matthew Wade to miss start of IPL 2024 for Gujarat Titans

author: Sparsh Vyas
content: Youtuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul will face legendary boxer Mike Tyson in an exhibition match on July 20. Tyson and Paul will lock horns at the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas, home to the NFL's Dallas Cowboys. 57-year-old Tyson reigned supreme in the boxing world as an undisputed champion between 1987 and 1990.
title: YouTuber to face Mike Tyson in boxing match

author: Atri Sanfui
content: Steve Smith's indifferent run as a Test opener continued after being dismissed lbw by debutant Ben Sears on the opening day of the Christchurch Test. Sears' third ball in Tests hit gold when Smith's attempt to shoulder arms backfired: the ball angled in off length and had him in a tangle. Smith instantly reviewed it, but replays confirmed his misjudgement.
title: Smith falls lbw shouldering arms to debutant, reviews in vain

author: Bhuvnesh Ojha
content: On being asked why he gave his towel to a fan after his first-round win against David Goffin at Indian Wells Open, Andy Murray said, "He was like a second coach." "It was constant cheering during...match [from the fan], but it wasn't just like 'Come on'. It was 'This is the best I've ever seen you serve, man'," he stated.
title: He was like a 2nd coach: Murray on giving towel to a fan after win

author: FPJ Online Edit
content: In a video that has gone viral on social media, Shadab Khan and Shan Masood were involved in a heated exchange during PSL 9 game on Thursday. The heated exchange likely transpired over the DRS usage as Shadab believed Masood had run out of time to take the DRS. In turn, Masood was asking Shadab to not intervene.
title: Viral video: Shadab and Masood involve in heated exchange in PSL 9
